1. Navigation Menu: A Navigation Menu is a navigation icon with three horizontal lines
on the corner of the Global Header.
2. Product name: It is defined by the application's name. It should always and only link
the user to the product's home page.
3. Modal header: The top section of the side panel consists of a modal header which
will give the user the option to close the panel by clicking the X icon. This modal header
is also present on the desktop side panel.
4. Navbar items: The navigation items are clickable links that direct a user to a specific
page of the application.
5. Backdrop: A backdrop is a semi-transparent overlay used to indicate that a portion of
the screen is inactive or disabled. It is only used on designs larger than 360px.
Responsive layout
The Ingka Co-worker Design Subsystem uses spacing, grids and breakpoints standards
from Skapa. Please read here if you are looking for general information about them.
Small and medium breakpoints
In specific use cases for small and medium breakpoints, there is also an option to use a
Bottom Bar Navigation. A Bottom Bar Navigation is a user interface element typically
used in mobile apps to display navigational options. It appears at the bottom of the
screen and can contain icons with labels. The Bottom Bar allows users to quickly switch
between different areas of the application and perform common actions.
Navigation Menu open Bottom Bar Navigation

This variant provides a backdrop to give visibility to the contents of the page.
Recommended for any designs larger than 600px.

For products that are more mobile-focused, there is the option to opt for Bottom Bar
Navigation. The Bottom Bar Navigation should never be combined with a Navigation
Menu.
Bottom Bar or Navigation Menu
[= fom 2 @® =] It's not allowed to combine a Navigation Menu and a Bottom Bar
on your layout. This can create confusion, inconsistency, and
clutter. Choose one navigation pattern that best matches your
use case. Conduct user research to determine the most intuitive
and efficient option for your users.

Accessibility
Keyboard interactions
The Navigation Menu is consisted of links to content. All items can be reached by Tab.
By using Enter key can activate any of the links, this will update the main content area
and put focus back to the top of the page.
The Heading (“Product name”) will receive programmatic focus when the modal is open
for the first time. The programmatic focus means that there will be no keyboard focus
visually shown in the screen, but it will be read by screen readers, so users using screen
readers can know they have landed inside the modal.
Activating the X icon (with Enter) on the top right corner will close the panel, and put
focus back to the triggering element, which is the Navigation Menu icon in the Global
Header.

Links can be reached by Tab, and Enter key is used to activate links. The numbers indicate the order of the keyboard interaction. Dismissing the panel will put back the focus to
the Navigation Menu icon in the Global Header.
Landmarks
Ingka Co-worker Design applies a navigation landmark around the Navigation Menu. If
a page includes more than one navigation landmark, each should have a unique label.
This help people who use assistive technology to make a mental model of a screen's
content.
